text: Champagnac is a small town (called a commune) in the southwest of France. It is in the Charente-Maritime department, in the region of Nouvelle-Aquitaine. ==Geography== The river Seugne forms most of the town’s southwestern border. == Population == The number of people living in Champagnac has changed over the years: == People == * Régis Messac (born 2 August 1893 in Champagnac – died around 1945 in a concentration camp) was a French writer. He was born in the schoolhouse in Champagnac, where his grandparents were teachers. ==Related pages== * Communes of the Charente-Maritime department ==References== ==Other websites== * Official website (in French) Category:Communes in Charente- Maritime
title: Champagnac, Charente-Maritime
